title: Day 711
content:
# Day 711

<iframe src="https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2F1zb2SuW-jug%3Ffeature%3Doembed&display_name=YouTube&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3D1zb2SuW-jug&image=https%3A%2F%2Fi.ytimg.com%2Fvi%2F1zb2SuW-jug%2Fhqdefault.jpg&key=a19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07&type=text%2Fhtml&schema=youtube" title="" height="480" width="854"></iframe>

If you would have told me two comedians would've convinced me the Bible deals with Aliens, that 10,000+ years ago we had advanced societies with probably better tech than we have today, and that this conversation would've strengthened my faith I probably would not have believed you. Sure enough though that is exactly what Joe and Katt did when I listened to this podcast.

Worth the listen. Glad to see Joe can post the whole pod on Youtube as well. Doesn't hurt either the Youtube comment section remains undefeated.

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*CzJmgKeN75IAmiwYEILMHQ.png)

One of the best pieces of advice given in the podcast is that the more you learn the more you realize the less you truly know. Also that time is circular and you can learn a lot about what will happen in the future based on the patterns of the past. The pod also made me want to get this book so I bought it off Amazon.

> [**The Emerald Tablet of Hermes**](https://amzn.to/3V1roAH)

3/2/24

Conor Jay Chepenik
